thread.title: Dell buys local data storage company EMC for record tech price - Innovation
thread.title_full: Dell buys local data storage company EMC for record tech price - Innovation

author: boston.com
title: Dell buys local data storage company EMC for record tech price - Innovation
text:
Dell has agreed to purchase Boston-area data storage company EMC for $67 billion, making it the largest tech acquisition ever, The Boston Globe reports.
Dell will take a huge amount of debt in the complicated cash and stock purchase, according to The New York Times. The price of $67 billion is also well above EMC’s market value of $53.6 billion.
Hopkinton, Mass. will become the of the new combined enterprise systems business, according to a statement.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below “I’m tremendously proud of everything we’ve built at EMC – from humble beginnings as a Boston-based startup to a global, world-class technology company with an unyielding dedication to our customers,” Joe Tucci, chairman and chief executive officer of EMC, said in a statement . “But the waves of change we now see in our industry are unprecedented and, to navigate this change, we must create a new company for a new era.”
Gallery: Major companies that call Massachusetts home.
Previous -- of -- Next New England Confectionery Company (NECCO), Revere. Famous for their sugary “Wafers,” the company also makes the Sweethearts everyone gives away on Valentine’s Day. Charles Krupa Previous -- of -- Next Biogen, Cambridge. Founded originally in Switzerland in 1978, the biotechnology company moved its headquarters to Cambridge in 1982. AP Photo/Biogen Previous -- of -- Next Staples, Framingham. The first Staples store opened in Brighton in 1986. Joe Raedle/Getty Images Previous -- of -- Next Ocean Spray, locations in Lakeville and Middleborough. Ocean Spray came to be when three cranberry growers formed the cooperative in 1930 and released their first product: jellied cranberry sauce. Tom Landers/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Gillette, Boston. More than 800 million men use the shaving products created by Boston’s Gillette, according to the company. The audio equipment company was founded in 1964 by Dr. Amar Bose, who was a professor at, and graduate of, MIT. Barry Chin/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Bain Capital, Boston. Mitt Romney (left) co-founded the private investment firm in1984. Justine Schiavo/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Samuel Adams/The Boston Beer Company, Boston. The brewery, known for its Boston Lager, was founded in 1985. John Bohn/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Au Bon Pain, Boston. Founded in 1978, the café bakery now has over 300 locations around the world. David L. Ryan/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Converse, Boston. Before it specialized in making popular sneakers for decades, Converse was a rubber shoe company and made galoshes. Jim Davis/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next 99 Restaurant & Pub, Woburn. The New England eatery was founded in 1952. Pat Greenhouse/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Liberty Mutual Group, Boston. The insurance company opened its first branch in Springfield in 1914. Barry Chin/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next BJ’s Wholesale Club, Westborough. The warehouse club began in 1984, and now has over 200 clubs in 15 states. Steven Senne/AP Previous -- of -- Next Friendly’s, Wilbraham. The chain began as an ice cream shop in Springfield in1935. Courtesy of Friendly's Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next New Balance Athletic Shoe, Inc., Brighton. The evolution of the sneaker company began in 1906 with the New Balance Arch Co. - "Arch support for problem feet." John Tlumacki/Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next The Yankee Candle Company, South Deerfield. The candle company has over 150 fragrances and makes most of its candles in Massachusetts. PRNewsFoto/The Yankee Candle Company, Inc. Previous -- of -- Next Dunkin’ Brands, Canton. The first Dunkin' Donuts opened in Quincy in 1955, and now there are 11,300 worldwide.
